data.event: In 1910, barrio Cagbagacay was renamed Concepcion after its patron the Immaculada Concepcion.

event.title: 12 September 1982, barrio Concepcion (Norte) together with barrios Bonga and Concepcion Sur were organized and created

data.event: On 12 September 1982, barrio Concepcion (Norte) together with barrios Bonga and Concepcion Sur were organized and created into a new municipality by virtue of Batas Pambansa Blg.

After the People Power Revolution in 1986 which toppled the regime of dictator Ferdinand Marcos, the town was renamed Santa Maria on 17 April 1988 by virtue of Republic Act No. 6651, again in honor of its patron the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary.

event.title: was renamed Santa Maria on 17 April 1988

data.event: After the People Power Revolution in 1986 which toppled the regime of dictator Ferdinand Marcos, the town was renamed Santa Maria on 17 April 1988 by virtue of Republic Act No. 6651, again in honor of its patron the Immaculate Conception of the Blessed Virgin Mary.
